intro: Antimima persistens, commonly known as the persistent antimima, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Antimima persistens is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions.
